_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



This submittal informs all interested parties that this facility is participating in the OSHA Process

Safety Management (PSM) program defined in 29 CFR 1910.119 and the EPA Risk Management Program

(RMP) defined in 40 CFR Part 68. These programs provide for the implementation of detailed prevention and

response procedures when storing and handling hazardous chemicals. The program objectives are to ensure

worker and public safety and to provide environmental protection.



Anhydrous ammonia is the only substance at the facility that is regulated under the PSM and RMP programs.

This is the same type of ammonia commonly sprayed on fields by farmers to fertilize crops.

Anhydrous ammonia is used as a refrigerant throughout the plant to maintain desired meat temperatures in

coolers, freezers and working areas. Expelling heat caused from altering the ammonia between a liquid and a

gas state creates refrigeration in the facility. This refrigeration system consists of a series of compressors,

condensers, evaporators, vessels, piping and valves.



The offsite consequences of analysis was determined utilizing RMP comp and the population data is based upon information pulled from Marplot. How to determine the WCS & ARS was derived from the EPA document, Risk Management Program guidance for offsite consequences of analysis (1999). 



The ammonia refrigeration system is operated with a variety of safety devices employed within the system,

included are high and low level automated shutdown systems and high and low pressure automated

shutdown systems. Alarm systems are utilized to provide early detection of problems within the system

before shutdowns occur.



This facilities emergency response program is an action plan to respond to and resolve incidents associated

with the ammonia refrigeration system. The Fire Department / Hazmat Team will be notified so that

they can provide assistance during an incident. If it is necessary to contact the pub

lic regarding an ammonia

release, the local fire department will be contacted to coordinate with the police department. The police

department will notify residents and business locations.



This facility has not had a reportable release in the past five years.



The facility utilizes Process Hazard Analysis, Compliance Audits, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews, Mechanical

Integrity inspections, Preventative Maintenance activity, equipment inspections, and training to ensure

mitigation and control of potential incidents.



The facility will make changes to the system and train as necessary to resolve items noted during the Process

Hazard Analysis, Compliance Audit, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews, and Mechanical Integrity inspections to

improve the safety of the system. Changes will be placed on an action list, evaluated, and implemented in a

timely manner.
